column4: they do support automatrix to the extent that folks pick up the pieces in here :-)
a quick question if I may?
what can i help you with?
would this --> sudo aptitude update  && sudo aptitude upgrade  give me the chance to uninstall the new update and reinstall the old one if it was borked?
no you have to install the old version
that's what I meant, if I use synaptic the old one is removed from my cache so I stuffed
using aptitude would allow to remove the dependencies when I com to uninstall
yes but the depends didnt cause the mess up im sure. and upgrading is just that upgrade not downgrade
I am looking for a possible way to 'roleback' on those odd occasions the devs mess up and let through a borked update, it has happen twice recently

if your using devel/testing version i would have to say get used to it. if you are running stable there are a few ways to downgrade easist is to download package from packages.ubuntu.com and install it with dpkg
ohh ok thanx, well I am using stable, i.e. dapper not edge
we got a troll in here
IDE has nothing to do with compiling an app. its use for writing code and compiling that code you wrote
I thought that is what he/she wanted to do
